scientific_name: Athyrium filix-femina var. angustum 'Lady in Red'

hardiness_location.full_iframe: <iframe frameborder=0 scrolling=yes seamless=seamless width=1000 height=550 style='margin:auto;' src='https://perenual.com/api/hardiness-map?species_id=1124&size=og&key=sk-kMpx68b02586bb61112084'></iframe>

description: The northern lady fern (Athyrium filix-femina var. angustum 'Lady in Red') is an amazing shade-loving perennial with distinctive features. The lacy foliage of this brilliant red fern is feathery and soft, adding texture and color to any garden. Its fronds provide excellent filtration for shady areas, keeping things cool and damp. As the seasons change the fern turns a deep red in the Summer and a golden-brown in the Fall. On top of being aesthetically breathtaking, the northern lady fern is easy to take care of and requires little maintenance.
